about.title: A Benchmark for a Market That Became Systemic
about.lead: GTIXT is a founderless, rules-first benchmark that exists to make the prop trading market measurable. We focus on mission, governance, and verifiability rather than personalities.
about.metaTitle: About GTIXT ‚Äî The Global Prop Trading Index
about.metaDescription: GTIXT is a founderless, rules-first benchmark for global prop trading. Learn about the mission, values, and governance model.

why.title: Why GTIXT Exists
why.lead: Markets mature when measurement replaces narrative.

untilRecently.title: Until Recently
untilRecently.text: Proprietary trading firms operated without standardized disclosures, consistent rule structures, comparable risk models, or verifiable historical records.

transforms.title: GTIXT Transforms This
transforms.text: GTIXT transforms publicly observable information into structured signals, applies a deterministic methodology, and publishes immutable snapshots that can be independently verified.

system.title: System, Not Personality
system.lead: GTIXT is intentionally founderless. It is governed by rules, not opinions; methodology, not discretion; evidence, not narratives.
system.note: GTIXT does not ask for trust. It enforces verifiability.

isIsNot.title: What GTIXT Is ‚Ä¢ What GTIXT Is Not

founder.title: Founder-light, System-first
founder.lead: GTIXT is designed as infrastructure. Authority comes from the system, not from personalities. We prioritize verifiable rules, public evidence, and deterministic process.
founder.note: GTIXT does not ask for trust. It enforces verifiability.

how.title: How GTIXT Works
how.lead: GTIXT runs as a deterministic pipeline: collect public data, validate evidence, score firms, enforce integrity gates, and publish immutable snapshots with cryptographic proof.

crawl.title: Crawl
crawl.text: Ingest public data from firm websites, regulatory databases, and official disclosures

validate.title: Validate
validate.text: Extract, normalize, and store evidence with timestamps and source URIs

score.title: Score
score.text: Apply deterministic 5-pillar methodology to compute rankings

gate.title: Gate
gate.text: Enforce data quality, NA policy, and consistency thresholds

publish.title: Publish
publish.text: Create immutable JSON snapshot and compute SHA-256 hash

integrityBeacon.title: Integrity Beacon
integrityBeacon.text: Public verification and audit trail for all stakeholders

pillars.title: The 5-Pillar Methodology
pillars.lead: GTIXT scores firms on five pillars of structural quality, each weighted and normalized.

transparency.title: Transparency (25%)
transparency.text: Public disclosure of rules, pricing, and operational structure

payout.title: Payout Reliability (25%)
payout.text: Track record and reliability of profit payouts and withdrawals

risk.title: Risk Model (20%)
risk.text: Quality and transparency of risk controls and equity protection

legal.title: Legal Compliance (20%)
legal.text: Regulatory registration, compliance history, and legal standing

reputation.title: Reputation & Support (10%)
reputation.text: Community reputation, support quality, and institutional backing

governance.title: Governance & Neutrality
governance.lead: GTIXT is governed by an explicit charter of neutrality, determinism, and transparency. Governance is framework-first: rules, processes, and auditability come before personalities.

noCommercial.title: ‚öñÔ∏è No Commercial Influence
noCommercial.text: GTIXT does not accept payments, sponsorships, or incentives from evaluated firms. Scores cannot be purchased or influenced.

noOverrides.title: ‚öôÔ∏è No Discretionary Overrides
noOverrides.text: Scores are deterministic and computed automatically. Identical inputs always produce identical outputs. No manual adjustments permitted.

auditable.title: üìã Fully Auditable
auditable.text: Every score is traceable to captured public evidence with timestamps and source URIs. Audit trails are immutable and public.

transparency.title: üëÅÔ∏è Complete Transparency
transparency.text: All scoring rules, data sources, and methodology are public and machine-readable. No proprietary black boxes.

institutional.title: Institutional-Grade Verification (v1.1)
institutional.lead: GTIXT v1.1 introduces advanced cryptographic verification, multi-level hashing, and provenance tracking for institutional compliance, audit, and regulatory use cases.

multiLevelHashing.title: Multi-Level Hashing
multiLevelHashing.text: SHA-256 hashes at evidence, firm, pillar, and dataset levels. Merkle tree aggregation enables proof of integrity without downloading entire datasets.

provenanceEndpoints.title: Provenance Endpoints
provenanceEndpoints.text: Advanced API endpoints (/api/provenance/*) expose hash chains, data lineage DAGs, evidence transformation history, and multi-level verification.

cryptographicSignatures.title: ECDSA-secp256k1 Signatures
cryptographicSignatures.text: Non-repudiation and tamper detection via ECDSA signatures on all hash levels. Enables independent verification of snapshot authenticity.

auditability.title: Institutional Auditability
auditability.text: Complete transformation chains, immutable evidence trails, and reproducible scoring. Built for institutional compliance, regulatory audit, and fiduciary verification.

forWhom.title: For Whom Is GTIXT?
forWhom.lead: GTIXT serves multiple institutional stakeholders with different information needs.

traders.title: Traders
traders.text: Evaluate prop firms objectively. Compare structural quality across candidates. Make informed career decisions.

institutions.title: Institutions
institutions.text: Assess counterparty risk and structural integrity. Benchmark prop trading exposure and governance standards.

regulators.title: Regulators
regulators.text: Monitor market structure, compliance patterns, and systemic risks. Reference data for policy development.

analysts.title: Analysts & Data Partners
analysts.text: Access clean, auditable market data. Build models and research on standardized benchmarks.

keyPages.title: Explore GTIXT
keyPages.lead: Dive deeper into GTIXT through our institutional pages.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.text: Complete 5-pillar framework, scoring rules, and NA policy

api.title: API Documentation
api.text: REST API reference and data access

closing.title: GTIXT Does Not Ask for Trust
closing.text1: We provide measurement. We publish evidence. We invite verification. Every snapshot is auditable. Every score is reproducible. Every decision is traceable.
closing.text2: GTIXT does not ask for trust. It enforces verifiability.

methodology.title: Deterministic ‚Ä¢ Evidence-Based ‚Ä¢ Versioned ‚Ä¢ Auditable
methodology.lead: Institutional-grade benchmark design for the global prop trading ecosystem. Every score is deterministic, traceable to captured public evidence, and versioned for reproducibility. GTIXT measures structural quality‚Äînot trader performance or financial outcomes.

principles.title: Design Principles
principles.lead: GTIXT is built on four foundational principles that ensure institutional credibility and scientific rigor.

deterministic.title: Deterministic
deterministic.text: Same inputs ‚Üí same outputs. No discretionary overrides. Scoring is spec-driven, reproducible, and immune to manual intervention.

auditTrail.title: Audit Trail
auditTrail.text: Every score is traceable to captured public evidence with timestamps. Inputs are stored immutably‚Äîenabling full historical reconstruction.

naNeutral.title: NA-Neutral
naNeutral.text: Missing datapoints are scored at a neutral baseline (0.5) to avoid rewarding opacity. Transparency is incentivized, not penalized.

versioned.title: Versioned
versioned.text: Methodology evolves through explicit versions (v1.0, v1.1, etc.). Past scores remain reproducible under their original version.

designPrinciples.title: Design Principles
designPrinciples.lead: GTIXT is built on four foundational principles that ensure institutional credibility and scientific rigor.

deterministic.title: Deterministic
deterministic.text: Same inputs ‚Üí same outputs. No discretionary overrides. Scoring is spec-driven, reproducible, and immune to manual intervention.

auditTrail.title: Audit Trail
auditTrail.text: Every score is traceable to captured public evidence with timestamps. Inputs are stored immutably‚Äîenabling full historical reconstruction.

naNeutral.title: NA-Neutral
naNeutral.text: Missing datapoints are scored at a neutral baseline (0.5) to avoid rewarding opacity. Transparency is incentivized, not penalized.

versioned.title: Versioned
versioned.text: Methodology evolves through explicit versions (v1.0, v1.1, etc.). Past scores remain reproducible under their original version.

scoringFramework.title: Scoring Framework
scoringFramework.lead: GTIXT v1.0 measures operational quality across five pillars. Each pillar is normalized (0‚Äì1), then combined via weighted sum to produce a final score (0‚Äì100).

formula.label: Master Formula
formula.note: Where each pillar_score is normalized to [0, 1] and weights sum to 1.0

normalization.title: Normalization
normalization.text: Each metric is mapped to [0, 1] via score maps, bins, or boolean mappings. NA values default to 0.5 (neutral).

aggregation.title: Aggregation
aggregation.text: Pillar scores are computed as weighted averages of their constituent metrics. Sub-pillar weights are defined in the spec.

fallbackChain.title: Fallback Chain
fallbackChain.text: When primary inputs are missing, fallback hierarchy is applied. If all inputs are NA, pillar defaults to 0.5.

dataCollectionAgents.title: Data Collection & Scoring Agents
dataCollectionAgents.lead: GTIXT v1.0 operates 8 specialized agents that collect evidence and compute metrics across the 5 pillars. Each agent is deterministic, auditable, and produces specific evidence types.

agentA.title: Agent A - Crawler
agentA.description: Fetches firm website HTML with Playwright/Puppeteer. Timestamps all evidence and stores raw snapshots in MinIO.

agentB.title: Agent B - Extractor
agentB.description: Parses HTML to extract structured rule data, pricing, payout terms. Detects changes vs previous versions.

rvi.title: RVI - Registry Verification
rvi.description: License verification (FCA, CySEC, ASIC). Confirms regulatory registration status and permissions.

sss.title: SSS - Sanctions Screening
sss.description: Watchlist screening (OFAC, UN, EU, PEP lists). Detects sanctioned entities and compliance risks.

rem.title: REM - Regulatory Events
rem.description: Monitors SEC, FCA, CySEC regulatory events. Tracks enforcement actions and compliance changes.

irs.title: IRS - Review System
irs.description: Processes manual submissions (complaints, disclosures). Validates evidence quality and relevance.

frp.title: FRP - Reputation & Payout
frp.description: Analyzes TrustPilot reviews, payout reliability, sentiment trends. Aggregates reputation signals.

mis.title: MIS - Investigation System
mis.description: WHOIS verification, company registration checks, news analysis, fraud pattern detection.

agentC.title: Agent C - Integrity Gate (Q2 2026)
agentC.description: Validates data quality before publication. Enforces NA-rate controls, detects anomalies, and determines universe inclusion. Currently in development‚Äîwill complete v1.0 release.

pillars.title: The 5 Pillars
pillars.lead: Each pillar measures a distinct dimension of operational quality. Weights reflect institutional priorities.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.desc: Clarity and accessibility of rules, pricing, fees, and terms. Measures whether a firm provides sufficient public information for evaluation.

payoutReliability.title: Payout Reliability
payoutReliability.desc: Structural consistency of payout logic and conditions. Evaluates whether payout rules are well-defined, explicit, and verifiable.

riskModel.title: Risk Model
riskModel.desc: Quality of loss limits, drawdown logic, and risk model type. Measures whether risk parameters are clearly defined and institutionally sound.

legalCompliance.title: Legal Compliance
legalCompliance.desc: Jurisdiction risk tier, disclaimer quality, and regulatory exposure. Evaluates whether the firm operates in a credible legal framework.

reputationSupport.title: Reputation & Support
reputationSupport.desc: External signals and support quality proxies. Captures Trustpilot ratings, domain age, and operational longevity as secondary indicators.

openSpec.title: Open Specification
openSpec.lead: The complete scoring specification is published as structured JSON. Every metric, weight, mapping, and fallback is machine-readable and auditable.
openSpec.note: Full spec includes all metrics, sub-weights, score maps, bins, fallback chains, and NA handling rules. Download the JSON for programmatic integration.

versioning.title: Versioning & Evolution
versioning.lead: GTIXT methodology evolves through explicit semantic versions. Each version is immutable and backward-compatible for historical reproducibility.

v1_0.title: Initial Release
v1_0.desc: Foundational 5-pillar framework with 30+ metrics. Covers transparency, payout reliability, risk models, legal compliance, and reputation.

v1_1.title: Refinement Update
v1_1.desc: Added agent-driven evidence extraction, enhanced NA policy, and integrity gate (Agent C). Improved score map precision for transparency metrics.

v2_0.title: Planned
v2_0.desc: Planned: SEC EDGAR integration, IRS agent enhancements, expanded legal compliance signals, and multi-jurisdiction risk modeling.

major.label: Major versions (v1 ‚Üí v2):
major.text: Breaking changes to pillar weights, metric definitions, or scoring logic.

minor.label: Minor versions (v1.0 ‚Üí v1.1):
minor.text: Refinements, new metrics, or enhanced data sources‚Äîbackward compatible.

historical.label: Historical reproducibility:
historical.text: All past snapshots include version metadata. Scores can be recomputed using original spec.

evidenceModel.title: Evidence Model
evidenceModel.lead: Every datapoint in GTIXT is backed by captured public evidence. Agents extract, validate, and link each input to its authoritative source.

excerpts.title: Evidence Excerpts
excerpts.text: Agents capture machine-readable excerpts from official sources (rules PDFs, terms pages, pricing disclosures). Each excerpt includes URI, timestamp, and extraction method.

uriProvenance.title: URI Provenance
uriProvenance.text: Every input links to its authoritative source URL. Auditors can verify that extracted data matches the official publication at the time of capture.

cryptoChain.title: Cryptographic Chain
cryptoChain.text: Source ‚Üí Excerpt ‚Üí Snapshot ‚Üí SHA-256 ‚Üí Pointer. This chain ensures that every score can be traced back to its regulatory and public origin.

capture.label: Capture:
capture.text: Agents crawl firm websites and extract structured data from rules, terms, and pricing pages.

validate.label: Validate:
validate.text: Agents check for missing fields, inconsistencies, and violations. Evidence is flagged if incomplete.

score.label: Score:
score.text: Validated inputs are mapped through the scoring spec. NA values default to 0.5.

snapshot.label: Snapshot:
snapshot.text: All inputs, scores, and evidence URIs are written to immutable snapshot JSON with SHA-256 hash.

indexScope.title: Index Scope & Universe
indexScope.lead: GTIXT covers proprietary trading firms offering funded programs and challenge-style evaluations. Universe inclusion is rule-based and deterministic.

candidate.label: candidate:
candidate.text: Eligible to crawl & score. Meets minimum data requirements.

watchlist.label: watchlist:
watchlist.text: Monitored, partial signals. Not yet candidate.

excluded.label: excluded:
excluded.text: Fails exclusion rules or insufficient public footprint.

items.footprint: Basic operational footprint (active website + identifiable entity)

integrityGate.title: Integrity Gate (Agent C)
integrityGate.text: Only firms passing the Integrity Gate are eligible for public publication. The gate is deterministic, spec-driven, and explains its reasons. GTIXT is resilient against "silent" low-quality data and prevents publishing unreliable rankings.

disclaimer.label: Disclaimer:
disclaimer.text: GTIXT does not provide financial advice, predict returns, or evaluate trader performance. It measures structural quality using publicly observable signals. Scores are not endorsements. Users should conduct independent due diligence.

roadmap.title: Future Development
roadmap.lead: Planned features, methodology evolution, and infrastructure enhancements for GTIXT platform.

governance.title: Governance Framework
governance.lead: Rule-based governance with institutional oversight, methodological transparency, and stakeholder engagement.

principles.title: Core Principles
principles.lead: GTIXT operates on eight foundational principles that ensure institutional credibility and scientific rigor.

determinism.title: Determinism
determinism.text: Scoring is fully deterministic and spec-driven. Same inputs always produce same outputs. No discretionary overrides, no manual adjustments.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.text: All scoring rules, weights, mappings, and fallback logic are published openly. No black boxes, no proprietary secrets.

auditability.title: Auditability
auditability.text: Every score is traceable to captured public evidence with timestamps. Full audit trails are available for independent verification.

nonIntervention.title: Non-Intervention
nonIntervention.text: GTIXT methodology cannot be overridden by commercial pressure, firm requests, or regulatory influence. Scores reflect the deterministic specification alone.

noCommercial.title: No Commercial Influence
noCommercial.text: GTIXT accepts no payments, sponsorships, or promotional arrangements from evaluated firms. Independence is structural, not just procedural.

evidenceBased.title: Evidence-Based
evidenceBased.text: Every datapoint is backed by captured public evidence. Inputs without evidence are scored as NA (neutral), not estimated or assumed.

oversightGate.title: Oversight Gate
oversightGate.text: An independent integrity gate (Agent C) validates data quality before publication. Defective data is rejected, not published.

versioning.title: Versioning
versioning.text: Methodology evolves through explicit semantic versions. Past scores remain reproducible under their original spec.

framework.title: Governance Framework
framework.lead: GTIXT operates through a layered governance structure that separates data collection, methodology design, integrity validation, and publication.

indexCommittee.title: Index Committee
indexCommittee.text: Responsible for approving methodology versions, reviewing structural changes, and validating index evolution. No authority to override scores.

methodologyLayer.title: Methodology Layer
methodologyLayer.text: Fully deterministic scoring engine defined by open specification (JSON). No manual overrides, no discretionary adjustments.

integrityLayer.title: Integrity Layer
integrityLayer.text: Agent C validates data quality, enforces NA-rate controls, detects anomalies, and applies integrity gate before publication.

publicationLayer.title: Publication Layer
publicationLayer.text: Snapshots published only after passing integrity validation. SHA-256 hashes ensure cryptographic verification.

framework.note: Key principle: No single person or entity can unilaterally alter scores. Methodology changes require version increments, documentation, and backward compatibility.

transparency.title: Transparency & Public Evidence
transparency.lead: GTIXT publishes all methodological rules, snapshot data, and evidence excerpts openly. Transparency is enforced structurally, not just promised.

openMethodology.title: Open Methodology Specification
openMethodology.text: All scoring rules, weights, mappings, and fallback logic are published as JSON specification files. No proprietary black boxes.

publicSnapshots.title: Public Snapshots
publicSnapshots.text: All snapshot data is published to MinIO object storage with SHA-256 hashes and cryptographic verification.

evidenceExcerpts.title: Evidence Excerpts
evidenceExcerpts.text: Each data point is backed by timestamped public evidence captured from official sources (FCA, OFAC, SEC EDGAR, etc.).

apiAccess.title: Open API Access
apiAccess.text: Programmatic access to all published data via RESTful API. No paywalls, no data embargoes.

oversight.title: Oversight & Integrity Gate
oversight.lead: An independent integrity gate (Agent C) validates data quality before publication. Defective data is rejected, not published.

completeness.title: Completeness Checks
completeness.text: Validates that all required data points are captured. Missing data is flagged as NA (neutral), not assumed.

anomaly.title: Anomaly Detection
anomaly.text: Detects outliers, unexpected score jumps, and data quality issues. Anomalies trigger manual review.

sourceVerification.title: Source Verification
sourceVerification.text: Confirms that all evidence is traceable to official public sources. No unverifiable data is accepted.

qualityGates.title: Quality Gates
qualityGates.text: Applies explicit quality thresholds. Data below quality threshold is rejected and not published.

oversight.note: Critical principle: Agent C has veto power over publication. No commercial pressure, corporate demand, or deadline can override the integrity gate.

independence.title: Independence
independence.lead: GTIXT operates independently from commercial, promotional, or financial relationships with evaluated firms.

noCommercial.title: No Commercial Relationships
noCommercial.text: GTIXT does not accept payments, sponsorships, advertising, or any form of compensation from prop trading firms. No paid placements, no promotional deals.

noInfluence.title: No Influence on Scores
noInfluence.text: Firms cannot pay to improve their scores, request manual adjustments, or influence methodology design. Scoring is deterministic and rule-based.

structuralSeparation.title: Structural Separation
structuralSeparation.text: Any future commercial activity (e.g., premium data access, institutional services) will be structurally separated from index methodology and publication.

conflictOfInterest.title: Conflict of Interest Policy
conflictOfInterest.text: Team members involved in methodology design or integrity validation cannot hold financial interests in evaluated firms.

neutrality.title: Neutrality & Non-Advocacy
neutrality.lead: GTIXT does not promote firms, jurisdictions, or business models. It is a neutral benchmark that reports facts.

doesNot.title: GTIXT does not
doesNot.item3: offer advisory services to evaluated firms
doesNot.item5: publish paid promotions or sponsored placements

enforces.title: GTIXT enforces
enforces.item2: no manual overrides or discretionary edits
enforces.item3: clear NA handling for missing data

dispute.title: Dispute & Corrections
dispute.lead: Firms may submit factual corrections with evidence. GTIXT reviews only objective errors.

item1.label: Evidence-based claims
item1.text: Corrections must include verifiable public sources.

item2.label: No negotiation
item2.text: Scores are not negotiated or adjusted on request.

item3.label: Transparent updates
item3.text: Changes are logged and published in the next snapshot.

economic.title: Economic Neutrality
economic.text: GTIXT does not profit from rankings. Data is published openly and remains accessible.

regulatory.title: Regulatory Alignment
regulatory.lead: GTIXT aligns with IOSCO benchmark-governance principles as a neutral data index; it is not a financial product.

iosco.title: IOSCO Benchmark Principles
iosco.lead: Our governance maps to IOSCO expectations for oversight, methodology, and accountability.

governance.label: Governance:
governance.text: Independent oversight and separation of commercial influence.

methodology.label: Methodology:
methodology.text: Public, deterministic rules with version control.

regulatory.note: GTIXT is not a regulator or advisor; it provides neutral benchmark data.

versioning.title: Governance Versioning
versioning.lead: Governance framework versions evolve through explicit semantic versioning. All past versions remain auditable and reproducible.

v01.title: Foundation (Q1 2025)
v01.text: Initial governance framework, core principles, deterministic scoring engine, and integrity validation layer established.

v10.title: Institutional Release (Q2 2025)
v10.text: Full institutional transparency, IOSCO alignment, multi-level hashing, ECDSA signatures, and agent validation services.

v11.title: Enhanced Institutional (Q1 2026)
v11.text: Provenance tracking, evidence archive operational, governance versioning, advisory board framework, and evidence-based corrections policy.

major.label: Major (X.0):
major.text: Structural changes to methodology, integrity gates, or governance framework. Past scores remain reproducible at prior versions.

minor.label: Minor (X.Y):
minor.text: Enhancements to transparency, reporting, or institutional features. Backward compatible with prior minor versions.

reproducibility.label: Reproducibility:
reproducibility.text: All versions published with full audit trails, evidence snapshots, and cryptographic signatures for independent verification.

advisory.title: Governance & Advisory Board
advisory.lead: GTIXT operates through a mixed governance model combining deterministic methodology with advisory board oversight. The advisory board provides independent checks on methodology evolution, governance policy, and institutional credibility.

composition.title: Advisory Board Composition
composition.risk: Risk Management & Compliance ‚Äî Independent directors with expertise in financial risk assessment, counterparty analysis, and institutional compliance frameworks.
composition.market: Market Integrity & Trading ‚Äî Seasoned trading professionals and market operators who understand prop trading, capital allocation, and market dynamics.
composition.data: Data Governance & Privacy ‚Äî Academic and industry experts in cryptography, data integrity, and institutional information security.
composition.trading: Trading Firm Leadership ‚Äî Senior executives from respected prop trading firms, providing industry perspective and credibility.

role.label: Advisory Board Role:
role.text: The board reviews methodology changes, validates governance policies, assesses market impact, and provides independent attestation. However, the board cannot override the deterministic scoring engine or interfere with individual firm scores.

cta.title: Explore Governance & Institutional Framework
cta.text: Learn more about GTIXT's institutional infrastructure, governance model, and transparency commitments.

reports.title: Reports
reports.lead: Quarterly and annual analysis of proprietary trading industry trends and regulatory developments.

meta.title: Reports ‚Äî GTIXT
meta.description: Institutional reports, benchmarking snapshots, and integrity analysis for proprietary trading firms.

reports.subtitle: Access institutional reports and benchmarking data

integrity.title: Cryptographic Verification for Institutional-Grade Data
integrity.lead: GTIXT publishes immutable snapshots with cryptographic hashes. Every data release is verifiable, deterministic, and auditable. Anyone can independently verify that the published data matches the official pointer‚Äîensuring integrity at every layer.

pointer.title: Latest Snapshot Pointer
pointer.lead: Real-time reference to the most recent published snapshot. Verify authenticity by comparing the expected SHA-256 hash with the computed hash of the downloaded file.

how.title: How Verification Works
how.lead: GTIXT employs a cryptographic chain to ensure data integrity from source to publication.

pointerPublished.title: Pointer Published
pointerPublished.textEnd: containing the snapshot object path and expected SHA-256 hash.

snapshotDownloaded.title: Snapshot Downloaded
snapshotDownloaded.text: Users download the snapshot file from the public MinIO bucket using the object path from the pointer.

hashComputed.title: Hash Computed
hashComputed.textStart: Compute the SHA-256 hash of the downloaded file locally using

verificationComplete.title: Verification Complete
verificationComplete.text: Compare the computed hash with the expected hash. A match confirms the snapshot is authentic and unaltered.

why.title: Why This Matters
why.lead: Cryptographic verification is the foundation of institutional trust in financial data infrastructure.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.text: SHA-256 hashes ensure that data has not been altered, corrupted, or tampered with at any point in the distribution chain.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.text: Anyone can independently verify data authenticity. No proprietary tools required‚Äîjust standard cryptographic utilities.

auditability.title: Auditability
auditability.text: Every snapshot is immutable and traceable. Regulators, auditors, and institutions can verify historical data integrity.

institutionalTrust.title: Institutional Trust
institutionalTrust.text: Cryptographic verification meets institutional standards for data integrity, regulatory compliance, and fiduciary responsibility.

manual.title: Manual Verification
manual.lead: Verify snapshots independently using standard command-line tools. No custom software required.

compareHashes.title: Step 5: Compare Hashes
compareHashes.note: The output from Step 4 should match the hash from Step 5 exactly.

api.title: API Verification
api.lead: Automate verification in your applications using standard HTTP requests and crypto libraries.

endpointLatest.title: Endpoint: Latest Pointer
endpointLatest.desc: Returns the latest snapshot metadata including object path, SHA-256 hash, timestamp, and record count.

evidence.title: Evidence Verification
evidence.lead: Each snapshot entry includes evidence excerpts and URIs for source-level traceability.

excerpts.title: Evidence Excerpts
excerpts.text: Every entity in the snapshot includes a machine-readable excerpt from its official source document‚Äîenabling programmatic verification without manual lookup.

uris.title: Evidence URIs
uris.text: Each entry links to its authoritative source (OFAC PDF, EU regulation, UN document). Auditors can verify that extracted data matches the official publication.

chain.title: Cryptographic Chain
chain.text: Source ‚Üí Excerpt ‚Üí Snapshot ‚Üí SHA-256 ‚Üí Pointer. This chain ensures that every data point can be traced back to its regulatory origin.

api.metaDescription: GTIXT public API documentation: latest pointer, snapshot structure, and usage examples.
api.title: Public Data API Specification
api.lead: RESTful HTTP API for accessing published integrity datasets. All endpoints serve immutable, cryptographically verifiable snapshots via static JSON files.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The GPTI XT API provides programmatic access to firm-level governance, transparency, and integrity metrics. Data is published as static JSON files stored on MinIO object storage infrastructure at 51.210.246.61:9000/gpti-snapshots/.
overview.principle1Desc: All datasets are versioned, content-addressed, and write-once
overview.principle2Desc: SHA-256 cryptographic hashing enables integrity verification
overview.principle3Desc: Scoring methodology is rules-based and fully reproducible
overview.principle4Desc: Complete API specification with no proprietary formats
overview.principle5Desc: No authentication required; all metrics are published openly

endpoint1.title: 1. Snapshot Pointer Endpoint
endpoint1.description: Retrieves metadata pointer for the current published dataset. This endpoint always references the most recent immutable snapshot available for consumption.
endpoint1.field2: Relative MinIO object path to dataset file
endpoint1.field4: Dataset metadata: pillar names, record count, schema version

endpoint2.title: 2. Dataset Retrieval Endpoint
endpoint2.description: Retrieves complete dataset containing all firm records with computed integrity scores and supporting metadata. Path value obtained from latest.json pointer response.
endpoint2.field10: Array of source documents with title and URL

verification.title: 3. Integrity Verification
verification.description: Verify snapshot authenticity using the SHA-256 hash provided in latest.json.

workflows.title: 4. Common Workflows
workflows.A: A. Find a firm by ID
workflows.B: B. Get top 10 firms by score

errors.title: 5. Error Handling
errors.status404: File does not exist (snapshot path invalid or expired)
errors.retryPolicyDesc: For production integrations, implement exponential backoff:

production.title: 6. Production Deployment
production.corsDesc: For client-side fetch from HTTPS domains (e.g., Netlify), MinIO must respond with:
production.httpsDesc: MinIO at 51.210.246.61:9000 uses HTTP. For Netlify (HTTPS-only), set up:
production.option1: Reverse Proxy (nginx) terminating TLS and forwarding to MinIO
production.option2: Or use MinIO's built-in TLS (self-signed or Let's Encrypt)
production.option3: Or use AWS S3-compatible endpoint with HTTPS support

support.title: 7. Support & Changelog
support.contactValue: For data access, CORS issues, or integration support, contact the GPTI team.

blog.title: Blog & Analysis
blog.lead: Institutional analysis, methodology deep dives, and research on proprietary trading transparency.
blog.notFoundDescription: This article doesn't exist or has been removed.

careers.title: Careers at GTIXT
careers.lead: Help us build the industry standard for prop trading transparency.
careers.noJobs: No open positions at the moment

note.title: About These Scores
note.textPrefix: GTIXT scores are calculated using a transparent, spec-driven methodology across 5 pillars:
note.textHighlight: Transparency, Payout Reliability, Risk Model Integrity, Legal Compliance, and Reputation Support.
note.textSuffix: Each firm is scored 0-100 based on 23 dimensions of publicly available data.

otherWays.title: Other Ways to Reach Us
otherWays.responseText: We typically respond to inquiries within 24 hours during business days (Monday-Friday, 9 AM - 5 PM EST).
otherWays.apiSupportText: API subscribers get priority support and dedicated technical assistance. See our
otherWays.dataCorrectionsText: If you represent a firm and believe information in GTIXT is inaccurate or outdated, please see our

apiAccess.q: How do I get API access?
apiAccess.a: Submit the contact form above with subject 'API Access & Integration' or email first@api.gtixt.com. Current public access is free (100 requests/hour). Authentication system with API keys is coming soon in Phase 2.

commercial.q: Is GTIXT data available for commercial use?
commercial.a: Professional and Enterprise commercial licensing tiers are under development and will be available soon. Currently, the public API is free for non-commercial use with attribution required. Contact us at legal@contact.gtixt.com for commercial licensing inquiries.

snapshots.a: Snapshots are published regularly as new data becomes available. The latest snapshot is always accessible via our API at /latest.json. Historical snapshots and time-series data will be available in Phase 2 (Q2 2026).

corrections.q: How do I request a data correction?
corrections.a: If you represent a firm and believe information is inaccurate, contact us via the form above with subject 'Support & Data Questions' or email support@center.gtixt.com. Include firm name, specific fields to correct, and supporting evidence. See our Methodology page for the full correction process.

confidence.q: What is the confidence level calculation?
confidence.a: Confidence scores reflect data completeness and quality: HIGH (80-100% data completeness), MEDIUM (60-80%), LOW (<60%). The calculation is based on the percentage of non-N/A values across all scoring criteria. See our Methodology page for complete details.

regulation.a: GTIXT is not a regulated credit rating agency or financial advisor. We are an independent institutional benchmarking platform providing data-driven analysis of proprietary trading firms using publicly available information. See our Disclaimer and Legal pages for complete details.

meta.title: Privacy Policy - GTIXT
meta.description: GTIXT Privacy Policy. How we protect and handle your data.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.lead: Last updated: January 2026. GTIXT is committed to transparency and protection of your data.

section1.title: 1. Information We Collect
section1.intro: GTIXT collects data in two distinct categories:

item1.title: Institutional Data
item1.desc: Publicly available information about proprietary trading firms, including regulatory filings, compliance records, and operational metrics.

item2.title: User Data
item2.desc: Information you provide when creating accounts, subscribing to our API, or contacting us (name, email, organization, API usage patterns).

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Data
section2.item1: To provide and maintain our institutional benchmarking service
section2.item2: To authenticate API access and monitor usage
section2.item3: To improve our methodology and data quality
section2.item4: To communicate important updates or security notices
section2.item5: To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

section3.title: 3. Data Retention
section3.para1: We retain institutional benchmarking data indefinitely to provide historical analysis capabilities. Historical snapshots are cryptographically secured and immutable.
section3.para2: Personal account data is retained for as long as you maintain an active account, plus 30 days after deletion for backup purposes.

section4.title: 4. Data Security
section4.item1: End-to-end encryption for all API communications (TLS 1.3+)
section4.item2: SHA-256 cryptographic verification for all data
section4.item3: Role-based access control for institutional data
section4.item4: Regular security audits and penetration testing

section5.title: 5. Your Rights
section5.intro: Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have the right to:
section5.item1: Access personal data we hold about you
section5.item3: Request deletion of your personal data
section5.item5: Data portability (receive your data in structured format)

section6.title: 6. Cookies & Tracking
section6.para1: GTIXT uses minimal cookies: authentication token (session), language preference (localStorage), and analytics (privacy-first, no third-party tracking).
section6.para2: You can disable cookies in your browser settings without affecting core functionality.

section7.title: 7. Third-Party Services
section7.para1: We may use selected third-party services for infrastructure (AWS), analytics (Plausible), and communication (SendGrid). These vendors are contractually obligated to maintain data confidentiality.

section8.title: 8. International Data Transfer
section8.para1: Data may be transferred to and processed in the United States and other jurisdictions where GTIXT operates. By using our service, you consent to such transfers.

section9.title: 9. Changes to This Policy
section9.para1: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. Material changes will be announced on our website. Your continued use of GTIXT constitutes acceptance of updated terms.

section10.title: 10. Contact Us
section10.mail: Mail: GTIXT, Privacy Team, 123 Financial District, New York, NY 10005

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.lead: Legal terms governing use of GTIXT services and data.

meta.title: Legal Disclaimer - GTIXT
meta.description: GTIXT Legal Disclaimer. Important legal information about GTIXT benchmarking data.

disclaimer.title: Legal Disclaimer
disclaimer.lead: Important: Please read this disclaimer carefully. GTIXT data is for informational purposes only.

section1.title: No Investment Advice
section1.para1: GTIXT provides institutional benchmarking data and analysis for informational purposes only. GTIXT is NOT providing investment advice, financial recommendations, or trading guidance.
section1.para2: Any decisions based on GTIXT data are the sole responsibility of the user. We strongly recommend consulting with qualified financial advisors before making investment decisions.

section2.title: Data Quality & Limitations
section2.intro: GTIXT methodology is based on publicly available information. We acknowledge inherent limitations:

item1.title: Confidence Levels
item1.text: HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW ratings reflect our assessment of data completeness, not absolute certainty. See our Methodology page for details.

item2.title: Currency
item2.text: Snapshots reflect information as of the snapshot date. Firms may have updated practices or status changes afterward.

item3.title: Data Sources
item3.text: Relies on public regulatory filings, news, and disclosed information. Non-public risks are outside our scope.

item4.title: No Audit Function
item4.text: GTIXT does not conduct independent audits or verify claims. We assess based on disclosed information.

section3.title: Not a Credit Rating
section3.para1: GTIXT integrity scores are NOT credit ratings, debt ratings, or financial strength ratings. They are institutional governance and operational integrity assessments. Do not use GTIXT scores as substitutes for formal credit analysis.

section4.title: Past Performance ‚â† Future Results
section4.para1: Historical GTIXT scores do not predict future firm behavior or performance. Factors change rapidly in institutional finance. Use historical trends with caution.

section5.title: Third-Party Reliance
section5.para1: GTIXT does not control content published by regulators, firms, or news outlets that we reference. We are not responsible for accuracy of third-party statements or changing regulatory information.

section6.title: No Relationship with Firms
section6.para1: GTIXT is an independent entity with no financial relationships with proprietary trading firms, brokers, or clearing firms whose data we publish. Our governance model ensures this independence.
section6.para2: However, firms may request data corrections if they believe information is factually inaccurate or outdated. See our Methodology page for our correction process.

section7.title: Trading & Market Risks
section7.para1: Proprietary trading is inherently risky. A high GTIXT score does not guarantee firm stability, profitability, or safety of capital. Firms with excellent governance still face market, operational, and regulatory risks.

section8.title: Regulatory Compliance
section8.para1: GTIXT is not a regulatory body and does not enforce compliance. Regulatory compliance is the responsibility of firms and their regulators (SEC, FINRA, FCA, etc.). GTIXT scores supplement but do not replace formal regulatory oversight.

section9.title: Limitation of Liability
section9.intro: GTIXT shall not be liable for:
section9.item1: Decisions made based on GTIXT data or scores
section9.item2: Financial losses, trading losses, or opportunity costs
section9.item3: Inaccuracies, delays, or omissions in data
section9.item4: Unauthorized use of API credentials or data
section9.item5: Third-party claims related to GTIXT data use
section9.note: To the maximum extent permitted by law, GTIXT's liability is limited to the fees paid by the user in the 12 months preceding the claim (or $0 for free tier users).

section10.title: Use at Your Own Risk
section10.para1: GTIXT data is provided "as is" without warranties. Users are solely responsible for evaluating the accuracy, completeness, and suitability of GTIXT information for their purposes.

section11.title: Indemnification
section11.para1: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless GTIXT, its founders, employees, and advisors from any claims, damages, or costs arising from your use of GTIXT data, including claims by third parties.

section12.title: Jurisdictional Notice
section12.para1: This disclaimer is governed by the laws of New York State. Users in other jurisdictions should be aware that GTIXT may not comply with all local regulations. Use of GTIXT outside the United States is at the user's own risk and responsibility.

section13.title: Questions?
section13.intro: If you have questions about this disclaimer or GTIXT's data and methodology:

docs.title: Documentation Hub
docs.lead: Technical guides, API documentation, and FAQs.

errors.404Desc: The page you're looking for doesn't exist.
errors.500Desc: Something went wrong on our end.

meta.title: Ethics & Neutrality ‚Äî GTIXT
meta.description: GTIXT Ethics & Neutrality Policy ‚Äî Independence, transparency, and institutional integrity.

ethics.title: Ethics & Neutrality Policy
ethics.lead: GTIXT is governed by strict ethical principles designed to ensure independence, transparency, and institutional-grade integrity.

section1.title: Neutrality
section1.text: GTIXT does not favor, promote, or penalize any prop trading firm, jurisdiction, or business model. All scores are generated deterministically from public data.

section2.title: Structural Separation
section2.text: Data collection, scoring, validation, and publication are strictly separated. No discretionary intervention is permitted.

section3.title: Conflict of Interest
section3.text: GTIXT does not accept payments, incentives, or partnerships that could influence rankings, scores, or visibility.

section4.title: Transparency & Auditability
section4.text: All methodologies are versioned. Snapshots are hashed, time-stamped, and reproducible. NA values are handled neutrally.

section5.title: Regulatory Neutrality
section5.text: GTIXT is not a financial advisor and does not issue investment recommendations. Regulatory indicators are risk signals only.

section6.title: Responsible AI
section6.text: AI assists detection and classification but never replaces deterministic scoring or audit logic.

section7.title: Governed Evolution
section7.text: Any change to methodology is documented, versioned, and publicly disclosed.

ethics.footerNote: GTIXT exists to measure reality ‚Äî not to shape it.

terms.meta.title: Terms of Service - GTIXT
terms.meta.description: GTIXT Terms of Service. Legal terms governing use of our platform.
terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.lead: Last updated: January 2026. Please read these Terms carefully before using GTIXT.
terms.section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
terms.section1.para1: By accessing or using GTIXT (the "Service"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to any part of these terms, please do not use GTIXT.
terms.section2.title: 2. Service Description
terms.section2.intro: GTIXT provides institutional benchmarking data for proprietary trading firms. The Service includes:
terms.section2.item1: Quarterly snapshots of firm integrity scores
terms.section2.item2: REST API access to historical rankings and data
terms.section2.para2: All data is based on publicly available information and GTIXT methodology. We do not guarantee data completeness or accuracy beyond our stated confidence levels.
terms.section3.title: 3. User Responsibilities
terms.section3.item1: Use the Service only for lawful purposes
terms.section3.item2: Not reverse-engineer, scrape, or attempt to circumvent API rate limits
terms.section3.item3: Maintain confidentiality of your API keys
terms.section3.item4: Not impersonate or misrepresent your identity
terms.section3.item5: Not upload viruses or malicious code
terms.section3.item6: Not use the Service to manipulate markets or spread disinformation
terms.section4.title: 4. Intellectual Property
terms.section4.intro: GTIXT's methodology, scoring algorithms, and proprietary analysis are protected intellectual property. You may:
terms.section4.canItem1: Use data retrieved via API for internal business purposes
terms.section4.canItem2: Reference GTIXT scores in reports (with attribution)
terms.section4.cantItem1: Republish GTIXT data without written permission
terms.section4.cantItem2: Create competing products based on GTIXT methodology
terms.section4.cantItem3: Sell GTIXT data to third parties
terms.section5.title: 5. Service Availability & Disclaimers
terms.section5.intro: GTIXT is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee:
terms.section5.para2: Scheduled maintenance windows (typically monthly) may cause temporary service interruptions.
terms.section6.title: 6. Limitation of Liability
terms.section6.para1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, GTIXT shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the Service, including but not limited to trading losses or business interruptions.
terms.section6.para2: Our total liability for direct damages is limited to fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.
terms.section7.title: 7. API Rate Limits & Usage Policies
terms.section7.intro: Rate limits vary by subscription tier. Exceeding limits may result in:
terms.section7.item2: Suspension of API access (if repeated violations)
terms.section7.para2: Commercial use requires appropriate subscription tier. Using free API keys for production systems is prohibited.
terms.section8.title: 8. Payment & Refunds
terms.section8.para1: Paid subscription fees are non-refundable except as required by law. You may cancel your subscription at any time; access continues until the end of your billing period.
terms.section8.para2: We reserve the right to change pricing with 30 days' notice.
terms.section9.title: 9. Termination
terms.section9.intro: GTIXT may terminate or suspend your account at any time for:
terms.section10.title: 10. Governing Law
terms.section10.para1: These Terms are governed by the laws of New York State without regard to conflict of law principles. You agree to submit to exclusive jurisdiction of courts located in New York County.
terms.section11.title: 11. Contact & Dispute Resolution
manifesto.meta.title: Manifesto ‚Äî GTIXT
manifesto.meta.description: GTIXT Manifesto ‚Äî The institutional benchmark for global prop trading.
manifesto.eyebrow: GTIXT ‚Äî Global Prop Trading Index XT
manifesto.title: GTIXT Manifesto
manifesto.lead: We are entering a new era of trading.
manifesto.section1.intro: For decades, the world of trading has been structured around two poles:
manifesto.section1.para2: Prop trading firms emerged between these two worlds ‚Äî without ever benefiting from institutional tools of measurement, transparency and governance.
manifesto.section1.conclusion: GTIXT was born to fill this void.
manifesto.section2.title: The fundamental problem
manifesto.section2.intro: Prop trading has become a global market, but it remains:
manifesto.section2.para2: Traders navigate without a benchmark. Firms evolve without standards. Regulators observe without a global indicator.
manifesto.section2.key: A market without an index is not a mature market.
manifesto.section3.title: What GTIXT is
manifesto.section3.item4: a common language between traders, firms and institutions
manifesto.section3.para2: GTIXT measures what actually exists, from public data, through a deterministic, audited, versioned and reproducible methodology.
manifesto.section4.title: What GTIXT is not
manifesto.section4.conclusion: GTIXT doesn't influence the market. GTIXT reveals it.
manifesto.section5.title: GTIXT philosophy
manifesto.section5.principle1.title: 1. Transparency precedes performance
manifesto.section5.principle1.text: A score without transparency is a noisy signal.
manifesto.section5.principle2.title: 2. The algorithm must be explicable
manifesto.section5.principle2.text: No "black box". Each result must be understandable, traceable, auditable.
manifesto.section5.principle3.title: 3. The absence of data is not a fault
manifesto.section5.principle3.text: It is a signal. It must be treated neutrally, never punitively.
manifesto.section5.principle4.title: 4. Stability is a trust factor
manifesto.section5.principle4.text: A model that changes constantly is a systemic risk.
manifesto.section5.principle5.title: 5. Neutrality is non-negotiable
manifesto.section5.principle5.text: GTIXT doesn't take sides. GTIXT chooses consistency.
manifesto.section6.title: An infrastructure, not a product
manifesto.section6.conclusion: But the core will remain untouchable: the index engine.
manifesto.section7.title: A historical transition
manifesto.section7.intro: GTIXT is at the junction of:
manifesto.section7.item1: the rigor of financial indices (MSCI, S&P)
manifesto.section7.conclusion: We don't replace anything. We structure what was missing.
manifesto.section8.title: Our commitment
manifesto.section8.conclusion: Credibility is not claimed. It is demonstrated, snapshot after snapshot.
manifesto.section9.title: Conclusion
manifesto.section9.para1: GTIXT is not just another project. It's a turning point.
manifesto.section9.para2: An index is born when a market becomes mature. Prop trading is entering this phase.
manifesto.section10.title: Founding principles
manifesto.footerNote: GTIXT doesn't influence the market. GTIXT reveals it.

data.integrity.sha256.title: SHA-256 Verification
data.integrity.sha256.description: Every snapshot includes an immutable SHA-256 digest. Verify file integrity by comparing the digest with published values.

data.integrity.immutable.description: All snapshots are versioned and immutable. Once published, they remain unchanged forever. Full audit trail available.

team.meta.title: Team - GTIXT
team.meta.description: GTIXT governance structure, leadership, advisors, and institutional affiliations.
team.title: GTIXT Team & Governance
team.lead: Meet the people and structures behind GTIXT institutional benchmarking standards.
team.governance.title: Governance Structure
team.governance.intro: GTIXT operates under institutional governance principles modeled on benchmark providers. Our structure ensures methodological rigor, transparency, and independence.
team.governance.board.title: Board of Governance
team.governance.board.description: Oversees methodology updates, quality standards, and institutional integrity. Meets quarterly to review scoring framework changes and governance policies.
team.governance.methodology.title: Methodology Committee
team.governance.methodology.description: Maintains the seven-pillar framework. Reviews evidence standards, confidence assessment protocols, and NA-neutral scoring policies.
team.governance.quality.title: Quality Assurance Gate
team.governance.quality.description: Oversight Gate review process. Validates every snapshot before publication. Ensures deterministic computation and audit-trail compliance.
team.governance.dataIntegrity.title: Data Integrity Team
team.governance.dataIntegrity.descriptio: Manages cryptographic verification, SHA-256 hashing, versioning, and immutable snapshot publication.
team.coreTeam.title: Core Team
team.coreTeam.intro: GTIXT methodology, operations, and infrastructure are managed by a team committed to institutional-grade benchmarking standards.
team.coreTeam.member1.title: Founder & Director
team.coreTeam.member1.name: Institutional Benchmark Operations
team.coreTeam.member1.bio: Oversees GTIXT governance, methodology integrity, and institutional partnerships. Background in systematic trading and benchmark standards.
team.coreTeam.member2.title: Methodology Lead
team.coreTeam.member2.name: Scoring Framework & Standards
team.coreTeam.member2.bio: Maintains the seven-pillar framework and oversees scoring criteria updates. Ensures methodological rigor and transparency.
team.coreTeam.member3.title: Data Engineering Lead
team.coreTeam.member3.name: Infrastructure & Verification
team.coreTeam.member3.bio: Manages snapshot generation, SHA-256 verification, versioning, and immutable storage infrastructure.
team.coreTeam.member4.title: Research Analyst
team.coreTeam.member4.name: Institutional Analysis
team.coreTeam.member4.bio: Reviews regulatory data, firm profiles, and institutional evidence. Supports firm scoring and quality assurance processes.
team.advisory.title: Advisory Board
team.advisory.intro: GTIXT benefits from advisors with deep expertise in proprietary trading, institutional benchmarking, regulatory compliance, and financial infrastructure.
team.advisory.trading.description: Former heads of institutional trading desks, risk management, and market operations providing real-world validation of scoring criteria.
team.advisory.compliance.description: Regulatory experts and compliance officers ensuring GTIXT methodology aligns with institutional standards and best practices.
team.advisory.technology.description: Infrastructure, cryptography, and data security specialists ensuring immutability, integrity, and audit-trail standards.
team.advisory.finance.description: Financial data experts and transparency advocates committed to institutional-grade benchmarking standards.
team.commitments.title: Institutional Commitments
team.commitments.rigor.title: Methodological Rigor
team.commitments.rigor.description: Every score is deterministic, rules-based, and reproducible. No subjective weighting or hidden logic.
team.commitments.independence.title: Independence
team.commitments.independence.descriptio: GTIXT governance is independent from firms evaluated. No commercial conflicts of interest.
team.commitments.transparency.title: Transparency
team.commitments.transparency.descriptio: Full methodology documentation, evidence criteria, and audit trails published publicly.
team.commitments.immutability.title: Immutability
team.commitments.immutability.descriptio: Every snapshot versioned, cryptographically verified, and permanently archived.
team.contact.title: Get in Touch
team.contact.description: Questions about GTIXT governance, methodology, or institutional partnerships? Contact our team.

contactMessages.title: Contact Messages
contactMessages.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this message?

punchline2: We index the economy of those who do.
tierADescription: Strong transparency, verified payout records, robust risk controls, and regulatory compliance.
tierBDescription: Adequate disclosures and track record, but gaps in documentation or compliance verification.
tierCDescription: Limited public information, unverified claims, or concerns about operational transparency.
tierDDescription: Significant red flags, regulatory warnings, or insufficient evidence of operational integrity.
dataConfidenceReflects: Data confidence reflects verifiability; higher confidence = more reliable score.
traderWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Market average ({avg}/100) is BELOW the institutional threshold of 60/100. Exercise caution - only {passRate}% of firms meet industry standards. Verify firm credentials independently.
traderPositive: ‚úÖ Market average ({avg}/100) meets institutional standards. {passRate}% of firms pass the 60/100 threshold score. Choose firms scoring above 60/100 for lower risk.
firmWarning: To reach the institutional threshold of 60/100 (currently {gap} points away), improve data transparency, regulatory compliance, and operational standards. Check /methodology for score breakdown.
firmPositive: Industry benchmark: {avg}/100. To stand out, target scores above {target}/100 by enhancing transparency and client protections.
analystsText: Distribution analysis: Average {avg}, Median {median} (spread: {spread}), Pass rate {passRate}%.
analystsSymmetric: Symmetric distribution suggests consistent market standards.
